identificationModule.briefTitle: Study of Avatrombopag for Temozolomide-induced Thrombocytopenia in Glioma (APATIT-G)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Pilot Study of Avatrombopag for Temozolomide-induced Thrombocytopenia in Glioma (APATIT-G)

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Assistant Professor - Department of Medicine , Hematology/Oncology (SMD)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine if using avatrombopag in patients with thrombocytopenia due to temozolomide treatment can safely improve a patient's platelet count and allow the patient to complete the temozolomide treatment course as planned.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The purpose of this study is to determine if using avatrombopag in patients with low platelet count due to temozolomide treatment is safe, while at the same time assess whether the avatrombopag can improve the low platelet count and allow the temozolomide treatment to continue as planned.

interventions.name: Avatrombopag
interventions.description: Avatrombopag is a small molecule thrombopoeitic receptor agonist (TPO-RA) that mimics the biological effects of thrombopoeitin (TPO)

primaryOutcomes.description: Measure of time from study enrollment until progression.
